color_usage.tone: warm, welcoming, and vibrant with earthy grounding tones
color_usage.style: flat colors with no gradients, shadows, or textures
color_usage.application: used as large, solid fills with clear visual separation between elements; limited blending or layering

typography_style.style: sans-serif, slightly rounded or geometric fonts
typography_style.hierarchy: simple, with soft emphasis on clarity and accessibility
typography_style.placement: used sparingly, often inside or adjacent to clean iconography or callouts

lighting_and_vibe.intensity: medium contrast with moderate-high saturation for color clarity

subject_placement.layout: centered or slightly off-center with balance
subject_placement.style: subjects float naturally within ample whitespace
subject_placement.focus: primary characters take visual priority with supporting icons or shapes arranged near eye-level or above

composition_layout.principles: light asymmetry or rule-of-thirds positioning used for organic feel
composition_layout.spacing: ample, uncluttered, no crowding of elements

branding_elements.shapes: rounded iconography such as speech bubbles, books, play buttons, and letters
branding_elements.strokes: no full outer strokes; subtle internal accents only (e.g., armpit lines, nose curves, neck folds)
branding_elements.motifs: organic additions like leaves, bubbles, or soft education-related symbols

visual_tone.maturity: broadly appealing to children, teens, and casual adult learners

post_processing_style.saturation: moderate to high, but never neon

character_styling.outlines: none on full body shapes; only used for minor internal accents like elbows, eyebrows, and minimal hair or fold definition

character_styling.hair: solid color with minimal accent shapes or flow lines
